Reviews.Title: “Very cool boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brad S
Reviews.Content: Every room is a new experience. Great location, excellent shape, responsive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the San Diego Zoo and Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Brklyn
Reviews.Content: We took a last minute trip to the San Diego Zoo, and arrived in town at 6:00pm on a Saturday with no place to stay. I'm SO glad I checked Trip Advisor and read about the Balboa Park Inn. We were lucky to get their last available room. The place was so great for the low ($99) price that we stayed an extra night. (In the summer, this place gets even better; they have a large sun deck and many outdoor dining tables.) The Balboa Park Inn must be the closest hotel to the San Diego Zoo. It's a VERY short walk through the park. Unfortunately, when we checked out we left some valuables in the room. The Inn phoned right away to alert us. Since we had already left town, they were nice enough to ship our things overnight. Great customer service all around!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Pammie_12
Reviews.Content: Reminded me of staying with relatives in an older house, very comfortable. The bed was not your typical hotel bed and the bedding was beautiful. There was quality furniture and Cuisinart cookware. It was surprisingly quiet considering the age and location of the building. Staff are friendly and housekeeping kept the place spotless. Down side? Could have had a slightly more substantial breakfast, other than pastry and cereal. Also could have done without it raining on our bed due to leaky roof. However, management has done the right thing and compensated us for that unfortunate event. And I'm told the roof has been repaired.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome bed & Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Balboa Park Inn for 4-5 nights back in July 2011, and it was great. We stayed in a room facing Balboa Park, on the first floor. The room had a very warm, homey feel. Kind of like staying in the guestroom at your grandmothers house. The bathroom was large, with a jacuzzi tub. it was kind of weird that the mini-fridge, microwave, and other kitchen supplies were in the bathroom, but we got over it. There is a Trader Joe's nearby where you can stock up on microwave-cooked foods. The daily breakfast was nice, they were always very friendly when you called and ordered. Always a great job cleaning the rooms when you're out for the day. The Inn is right across the street from Balboa Park. We jogged through the park every night. We walked to the San Diego Zoo easily. There is also a bus stop right there that goes in Downtown San Diego, convenient way to avoid drinking/driving at night. The parking is sreet parking, and it can be tricky, but I stay in North Jersey a lot so it was really no big deal, just like home. There is always somewhere to park, it just always isn't right in front of your hotel. The staff was great and friendly, they were able to hook us up with a nicer room upon check-in for no extra cost. We originally were going to be in one room for 2 nights, then switch to a smaller room for the remaining nights. They ended up letting us stay in the larger/nicer room for the same price as the smaller room. I would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: 346SueU
Reviews.Content: Breakfast served daily; comfortable, conveniently located to Balboa Park and buses to all parts of the city. Located in happening Hillcrest area. Excellent service and welcoming. Clean. Free wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very kitsh”
Reviews.Author: mojave
Reviews.Content: The hotel (or is it a large B&B?) is locateed in a couple of old houses in a beautiful residential area along Balboa Park. The decor is resolutely kitsh, it is a matter of taste of course. Upon entering the room, one is struck first by the decor, and at the same time by the excessive smell of air freshener. That, too, is a matter of taste, but breathing these chemicals all night long cannot be very healthy. I did not like the envelope requesting a tip for the maid, to be handed at the desk on check-out. Don't they pay their staff? The bed was good, wifi was clear, there were a fridge, coffee machine, microwave, and everything was very clean. Continental breakfast is brought to the room, which is nice. Parking is on the street, easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Jungle Nook!”
Reviews.Author: chiwawa4556
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed in the Jungle Nook room at Balboa Park Inn. The room is decorated in a way that some might find "over the top," but I thought it was very fun! The walls are painted to look like jungle plants and there are exotic animals everywhere. There were even a few Christmas deocrations added here and there, which we thought was a very nice touch. I thoroughly enjoyed watching TV while I took a shower in the huge shower built for two. Didn't get a chance to use the huge bathtub surrounded by flameless candles, but hopefully I will next time. The room was VERY clean and comfortable. I did not smell any mold that previous reviewers ave mentioned. The staff was friendly and attentive without being intrusive. The breakfast was more than enough to get us going for the day. Each day we had an assortment of breakfast breads and pastries including a cinnamon roll, mini muffins, panetone (my new favorite!), croissants, and various other things. My husband also ordered cereal each morning and we both had juice. There is a well-stocked coffee bar in the room as well as a microwave and a fridge. This room is adjacent to a beautiful courtyard where we enjoyed our breakfast the first morning of our stay. It was very quiet. I did hear a little bit of noise from our neighbors above us on the first night of our stay, but nothing that was going to keep me awake. The Inn is walking distance from the San Diego Zoo and Balboa Park and an easy drive from Sea World. The only negative things I can say about this property are these: They have no parking lot, so you have to park on the street. Some areas are No Parking at certain times on certain days, so you have to pay attention. There was never any hot water in the bathroom sinks, and it took a little while to get hot water in the shower. The Jungle Nook room is great for couples, but the setup of the bathroom areas wouldn't be good for traveling with friends or relatives as there is little to no privacy. (Not really a negative, just something you should know.) And that's it. Everything else was wonderful and I can't wait to go back again. I would definitely recommend Balboa Park Inn to anyone looking for a fun place to relax!

Reviews.Title: “Great B&B, walking distance to the San Diego Zoo!”
Reviews.Author: RockhopperPenguin
Reviews.Content: I mainly selected this place because it sounded nice and was walking distance to the zoo. The rooms have personality as others have said and my wife really liked it. Breakfast was good and the area is great, no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Cute, kitschy and a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: veenas
Reviews.Content: This place has it all- very nice location, excellent service, and unique, awesome character! We were supposed to stay in one of the regular rooms, but got upgraded to the Bon Vivant suite, which was just ab fab. It reminded me of a grandma's house from the 70's- but in a good way. The living area faces the street, but the bedroom was in the back so it was nice and quiet for a peaceful sleep. The staff was all very friendly and punctual with the breakfast when ordered. Location is super convenient to the zoo (5 min walk) and University Ave (10-15 min walk) restaurants/ nightlife. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Inn in a great location”
Reviews.Author: aligobs
Reviews.Content: Unknowingly we booked a trip to San diego during Comic Con and found all hotels had jacked the price up. This little inn was the exception but we were leary. Since the location was so good (right next to Balboa Park) and down the road from my sons house we said what the heck. We are so glad we did! The staff was excellent, the rooms were awesome! Fireplaces, comfortable beds, and a courtyard so pretty I didn't want to leave. I will be returning to the Balboa Park Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful property and staff, somewhat tacky decor :)”
Reviews.Author: JMGinPDX
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Balboa Park Inn in San Diego's Hillcrest neighborhood in mid-October 2011. Our room was the "Medley Suite," a 2nd floor suite with a living room, bedroom, bath, and sizable full kitchen. Other amenities included free continental breakfast delivered to your room with more than enough pastries for 2 adults and a toddler, coffeemaker and coffee, and cable TV (there may have been internet as well but I didn't use or research it). At $149/night + tax it was a bit more than we usually like to pay, but well worth the money for the location and comfort. The property is located at the corner of Park and Upas, literally a 5-minute (if that) walk to the gates of the San Diego Zoo, the carousel and the miniature railroad. El Prado and the natural history and science museums are about 10 minutes' walk, and a playground for our 2-year-old about 15-20 minutes' walk. We rented a car, and were able to drive no more than 10 miles in different directions to get to East Mission Bay, downtown and the Gaslamp, Sea World, and the ferry to Coronado. The airport rental car agency was literally a 5-minute drive, and the shuttle ride back to SAN took about 3 minutes. All of that meant to say - there is very little reason to stay in any other part of San Diego, especially the overrun, noisy and congested Hotel Circle. Just another 2 minutes southeast and you can stay in a quiet, suburban and slightly upscale neighborhood that is very close to all the things most people go to San Diego for, in some cases closer than you can get by being right off the freeway. In addition, by being on the eastern end of the Hillcrest district, we were close to a vibrant and historic neighborhood with lots of interesting culture, a vibe that appealed to a couple of Portlanders like us, and wonderful restaurants like The Tractor Room. Our first impression in the lobby was that is was friendly and comfortable, but a bit on the over-decorated and tacky side (at least for semi-snobs like us who prefer simplistic modern Scandinavian and Asian decor ;)) The staff was wonderful and unobtrusive - the only times we saw employees was when the sweet housekeeping/service ladies brought us breakfast, and when we checked in! The room itself was comfortable, but again, a bit overly decorated with fake plants, mismatched paintings and sculptures and outdated furniture, pink tiles in the bathroom...it actually reminded me a lot of my grandmother's apartment circa 1975. I can appreciate kitschy/hip, but this was just plain tacky. Again, that is likely not important to most people and ultimately wasn't important to us either. Our room opened on to a deck that led to the sun terrace, a large and comfortable spot for taking in the beautiful San Diego weather. really appreciated the full kitchen, complete with 3/4 size fridge, stovetop, oven, microwave, and all the utensils, dishes, cookware, etc. you would find at home. The cleaning staff was even nice enough to do the dishes for us, including the toddler-friendly utensils, cups and bowls we had brought along from home!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Christine R
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this delightful B & B. The rooms were spacious and clean, the service was very friendly and they went out of their way to help us in any way they could. I had a dental emergency our second day there and they not only came up with a list of local dentists but hand delivered it to our room and then followed up the next day. The location was so close to Balboa Park that most all museums and the zoo were withing walking distance. Parking on the street never a problem, most of the time getting a parking space almost in front of our suite. We stayed in the Monet and it felt as if we were staying in an apartment. This is a definite revisit for us in the future. I would recommend this to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Darling Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Scottysgirl01
Reviews.Content: This little bed and breakfast style property was an absolute delight!! The room was clean and decorated in a theme like fashion. From the front desk staff to the housekeeping staff they were always friendly and helpful, yet not intrusive in any way. I will be back for sure...in fact in Sept. 2011!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Aucaman
Reviews.Content: This was more than the average B&B place. It's a set of old San Diego homes converted into very attractive small suites with everything you need for a fun long weekend. We had the feeling that we were staying in some friends' old apartment. We had gone to attend theatre performances at The Old Globe in Balboa Park and this Inn could not be better located. We also enjoyed a visit to the famous San Diego Zoo, just a five minute walk. We would definitely go back on our next visit to The Old Globe Theater.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back next time we are in San Diego, near San Diego Zoo!”
Reviews.Author: illini_knight
Reviews.Content: Unique B&B with charm, good rates, and wonderful location (if you want to walk to San Diego zoo, you can in five minutes!). PROS: Service was good, free internet, unique decor in rooms (never seen any hotel quite like this one), beds are in great condition, fairly reasonable breakfast brought right to your room, lots of in-room resources to local attractions/restaurants/etc... CONS: Small bathrooms, can get a bit noisy (depends on which room), oddly shaped rooms (we stayed in Victorian room this time around, and our bed was diagonal in room, kinda odd, but I guess it works), very small tv (we never used it, but if you want a big tv, it isn't). In July 2009 my wife and I stayed in the "City Lights" room and it was very similar to our current stay in 2011. We will certainly return next time we are in San Diego. Both times we paid about 90-100 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms but terrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Travelingpossum
Reviews.Content: If you won't use the sofa bed or do not plan to eat their breakfast, this is a perfectly fine place to stay. The suite is very spacious and a good value for the price. The roof top terrace is very nice. The bed in the master bedroom was quite comfortable. The location is excellent. We walked to the zoo and museums in Balboa Park. It's also a short drive to many superb restaurants in nearby Hillcrest. However, the breakfast was composed of cereal or vending-machine quality pastries (one donut was still wrapped in plastic as you would find at 7-Eleven). The breakfast was similar to those I’ve had at low-end chain motels. A motel that calls itself a B and B should be embarrassed to serve such low-quality food. We ate the breakfast once; for the remaining days we went out. The sofa bed is VERY uncomfortable. It pulls out from a tiny loveseat (so is much smaller than a twin bed) and has a thin mattress covering through which the springs can be felt. My adaptable teen son was able to deal with it, but most adults would be too uncomfortable to sleep on it.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous, again!”
Reviews.Author: TripPlanPro
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this B&B across the street from the San Diego Zoo for the 3rd time, and continued to really like it. The location is so peaceful [except on the morning of the Rock & Roll Marathon which goes right by the building at Mile 2, and then the location's just plain fun], and the neighborhood's so tranquil compared to the congestion and stress of the big hotels along the marina. Every room in the Inn is different. We've stayed twice in City Lights, which is on the 2nd floor, has a couch & kitchenette, and very nice view out to the street. We've also stayed in the Jungle Room, which is wild, has a much larger bathroom, and is also memorable, but is on the first floor, opens out onto the center patio and therefore has little natural light if you're going to be hanging out during the day. The breakfast that's provided at the Inn is very tasty -- although could use some fresh fruit. It includes cereal, juice, coffee & assorted pastries, and is brought to your room anytime after 7:30 am, which is also a very nice touch [would be better for the business traveler, however, if it could be available by 7 am]. The inn is actually several 2-story homes/apartment buildings all linked together on the corner across from Balboa Park at the Zoo [expect the bathrooms to be 'vintage' as a result], so it has an especially homey feel. You could live there indefinitely and not feel that you're in a hotel. The room across the hall from City Lights, in fact, has a living room, kitchen and bedroom -- it's a full-on apartment. No matter which room you take, if you have to be in San Diego for business or pleasure, couldn't recommend this B&B more! Parking's free on the street -- although sometimes difficult to find -- and the stay will make you want to stay longer. [Only real drawback -- wireless Internet access is quite sketchy & on-again/off-again. It would help if the management would make it reliable 24x7 for people who are in San Diego on business, or even those traveling on vacation. Reliable online access is considered standard at urban hotels here in the 21st century.]

Reviews.Title: “Budget friendly for extended family without giving up a comfy bed and a clean room.”
Reviews.Author: swsteph
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at Balboa Park Inn and it is still wonderful! We visited San Diego with grandparents and small children. The owner kindly upgraded my parents so they could stay closer to us. Our room connected to a big back porch where people could hang out after the kids went to sleep. The breakfasts were substantial enough to get us going. The kitchen allowed up to keep kid friendly snacks on hand so we did not need to purchase them at expensive stands while site seeing. There are a number of good restaurants and a Trader Joe's near by to load up on snacks that you can keep fresh in the kitchen in your room. The location is fantastic. It is easy walking distance to the zoo and other wonderful sites in Balboa Park and a quick drive to Sea World or a baseball game to see the Padres. Balboa Park in is a budget friendly place to stay without giving up a comfy bed and a clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Cute rooms”
Reviews.Author: travellerZ_rich
Reviews.Content: All of the rooms in this hotel are unique. We stayed for 3 nights in Room #3: Paris in the 30s. I just love the names! The room was very cute, lots of decoration and "stuff", but still clean. You could tell from the way the towels were folded, that the owners have attention to detail. Coffee and tea making facilities in the room, as well as a microwave. Breakfast (included in the price) can be served to your room. It consists of cereals, milk and some sweet cakes, coffee and tea. Free Wifi. It is right next to Balboa Park so you can go for a run in the morning or walk to the zoo and all the museums. The only thing that bothered me a lot was that our shower didn´t work properly. The water pressure would just disappear during the shower, leaving me with shampoo in my hear but with no water coming from the top, only from the bottom tap. I reported this to the reception lady, but the issue had mysteriously vanished when they checked it. All in all, we enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Beds & Service Ever!”
Reviews.Author: ecotravelling
Reviews.Content: Found this little Gem online. Lived up to expectations. PERRRFEEEECCT location opp Zoo & Park & close enough to all things gay downtown. Had the best beds I've ever slept on. Super clean, friendly & accomodating. My place in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinVagabond
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our recent stay at BPI. We had the most inexpensive room class, $99, but it was adequate in size and had a walk-in closet, a frig, coffee maker, and microwave oven. We received more than enough pastries and cereal at our continental breakfast, served 5 minutes after we called, either in our room, on the terrace, or up on the sun deck. The grounds of the hotel were nice, with the rooms in three separate buildings side-by-side on Upas Street. We had a Midnight check-in, and were wisked to our room as soon as we showed up. We had to park our car about a block away at times, but at least it was free. We met the owner, Edward, at check-out and he was very pleasant. The hotel is very convenient to the Hillcrest neighborhood, and is at the north entrance to Balboa Park. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Eclectic and Close to Balboa Park”
Reviews.Author: Rororosie
Reviews.Content: If you are a musuem/zoo buff, this is the best value in San Diego for a trip! I could walk down to the park. The parking is on the street but for me this was not a problem. I didn't mind parking close by in the neighborhood. The rooms are very eclectic, almost to an extreme, but I found that quite amusing. I have stayed in the Harlequin and The Aruba so far. They are very, very comfy!

Reviews.Title: “charming!”
Reviews.Author: hu11nt
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the sterile monotony of a chain hotel, look elsewhere. If you are looking for aplace with personality, that feels more like home, check out the Balboa Park Inn. We came to town for a medical conference with a few extra days allotted for fun with the family. Balboa Park Inn provided us with all of the comforts of home, including a full kitchen, living room in which to visit with the family, and delightful terraces and balconies. The bed was the most comfy we've ever experienced in a hotel. Each room has a different decorating theme, so I can't speak for all of the rooms. Ours was quirky, but lovely with a number of interesting touches such as cross-stitch embroidery on the sheets, embroidered shower curtain, and Waterford crystal in the lighted display case in the living room. All of this came at a price significantly less than the boring bed and bath that we would have had at the Hyatt in which the conference was held. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is a short walk from the San Diego Zoo and Balboa Park.Breakfast was included in the price and was served in the room...cereal and yummy hot pastries and croissants. All that and a perfect central location made this a wonderful choice. We will absolutely return. friendly and helpful rooms

Reviews.Title: “Our Five Star Resort”
Reviews.Author: Bert_Ayala
Reviews.Content: Well my wife and I are San Diego natives and this year for our tenth anniversary we had this great idea to stay close to home and just find a nice place to relax and get away from it all. So we picked this wonderfully charming hotel to spend a few days together alone. We chose the Balboa Park Inn, mostly because of it close proximity to Balboa Park and one of our favorite restaurants The Prado. We checked out a few of the other themed rooms the Inn had to offer, each had its own unique flavor and exquisite furnishings. We were impressed by their attention to details and after much deliberations we settled on their very best room the Tara Suite. The suite was very spacious, beautifully & uniquely decorated, the furnishings were even more impressive starting with a fancy gold silk down filled Sherrill sofa to relax on, a wonderful Empire style Century Furniture dresser for our clothes with the matching desk, a beautiful Theodore Alexander accent chair with the matching console...no cheap particle wood hotel furnishings here. The entire suite was impressive to say the least. As you continue through to the rear of the suite you are surrounded by the romantic aroma of scented candles all around you (all electric and remote controlled). In the corner is a large bar with all the kitchen amenities discreetly tucked behind it, a microwave, coffee pot and wine glasses. But the best part about this suite is the oversized jacuzzi and European style bathroom all so cleaned it looked brand new as if we were the first to use them. The bathroom was unique in that it had no door! Just a simple wall defining the private space. There were two showers next to the jacuzzi one was a big rain shower head which was great to use. The room was so nice we spent more time inside than out. The service was outstanding. The staff is very knowledgeable, pleasant, and helpful at any hour. We received a level of customer service we had only experienced in five star resorts. I am not in the habit of writing reviews or talking up any establishment but honestly any one considering a nice romantic place to stay here in San Diego and at great prices do not look any further. This is our favorite get away and it will soon become yours!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional - 5+++”
Reviews.Author: DPD123
Reviews.Content: All staff were great. Our suite, #24 was very recently renovated - clean as a pin and most new. Don't go by the photo of it on their website. My guess is that things are being renovated throughout the Inn. We received a complimentary upgrade which made our stay a tremendous value. The Inn is unique and, for us, it had a "home-like" feel. If you want to pay $100-$150 more for fancy digs, knock yourself out. The Inn is within walking distance (20-40 minuets) of great, inexpensive restaurants, Trader Joe's and Ralph's, a major grocery store. Being on the edge of Balboa Park was a major advantage. The zoo is a 10 minuet walk. Another 10 minuets gets you into the heart of the Park. Bus stops are across the street if you need public transportation. BPI is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “dated, musty, over decorated and not central to anything”
Reviews.Author: predatorlover
Reviews.Content: Boy did i make a mistake booking here. Unfortunately I did it based on the reviews i read on line, which must have been written by the owner or thir friends. Now I will try to protect the next person. First off we were greeted by a smoky smelling front desk area, and a most unfriendly gentleman who yelled at his housekeeping staff in front of us, which I was appalled by, and followed up with commenting on the weight of our suitcases. Suddenly we were "upgraded". to a room on the first floor (can you say "too out of shape to lift our suitcases a flight of stairs"). This Inn was eclectic for sure...like NOTHING in our room went together, it was overdecorated with fake flowers everywhere and was musty smelling, covered over with cheap air freshener. If this was an upgrade I would hate to have seen where they were planning to put us to start with. It was advertised as close to Balboa Park..I don't think so. Everytime we went to Balboa park it was a $8 cab ride. It was near NOTHING...it was in a residential neighborhood with a restaurant 8 blocks up and three blocks over. The clencher was there was no service to print our boardig passes. I nearly came out of my skin when the lady at the desk said we could go to Kinkos! The best part of this hotel was the housekeeping staff, and the cab that drove us away the second morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Anne_Peters_618
Reviews.Content: Great location, quiet and clean. Other guests were lovely too

Reviews.Title: “Funky, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Leveetrash
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times and it never disappoints. The location can't be beat. The SD Zoo, Balboa Park are right outside your door. Close to downtown. 10 minute drive to airport. It is in the Hillcrest neighborhood which has lots of shopping and restaurants. It is offbeat so may not be for everyone. Those who enjoy cookie-cutter one room Hotel Circle type places should stay away. Someone I know who has no sense of adventure, imagination or fun (she lives on a golf course in a planned community) stayed here once on my recommendation and found it "disturbing" which means it is perfect for people like me. Each room is decorated differently. My last stay was in The Monet #5 $149, bk included. Separate sitting room, good size full kitchen, quiet, porch overlooking the deck area. The full kitchen is always a good feature if you are staying a while so you don't have to eat out all the time. They will bring your breakfast to the room or to the outside deck area. The deck area is a nice feature. We had wine outside in the evening and met some other people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Inn :)”
Reviews.Author: TripsandFalls
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Balboa Park Inn from Friday to Monday and we were very pleased with the establishment. The staff was very nice, the facility was beautiful, rooms were clean and the area is quiet and peaceful. The rooms are quarky, however they were very clean and comfortable. We stayed in Vicorias Secret and Monet's. They mistakenly over booked the VS room and had to move us for the last night, but they made the transition very easy. The hotel is in walking distance to the zoo, which is great because the parking for the zoo on the weekend was horrible. And there is a bus stop right in front of the hotel that stops @ the zoo, Balboa Park and goes into downtown SD. Down side- coffee pot in the room and a few little treats for the continental breakfast, but there is a cafe about 3 blocks away that had good coffee and breakfast. I would recommend this Inn if you are staying in the San Diego area :)

Reviews.Title: “Charming, close to zoo, great value”
Reviews.Author: absolute_di
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Aruba room of this charming B&B. Our room was probably the smallest room they had, but it was adequate for the two of us. We are of slim physique and only had two carry-on luggage and there was just enough space for our stuff and to move around. I wouldn't recommend this room for anyone that likes spaciousness or have lots of bags. The bathroom on the other hand is HUGE, it's about 1/2 the size of the bedroom! It's got a jacuzzi with bubble oil supplied. The room is well equipped with: dishes, bowls, utensils, fridge, coffee maker, coffee, tea, ironing board + iron and hairdryer. There's also an ice box in the courtyard. The free wi-fi internet was also a plus and much appreciated. We found the courtyard decorated with lots of plants and small ornaments really charming. It was a nice little place to sit and enjoy breakfast. The breakfast consisted of juice, pastries, and cereals. The pastry basket only has 4 pieces of pastries. The croissant and mini muffins were the best, so try getting extras. Conveniently located next to the zoo and close to Balboa park. In fact, it's probably a 10 minute walk to the zoo if you don't want to drive and find parking. Balboa park is also very close by and a must-see. I wish we had more time to spend at the beautiful park. Street parking (on the side street) was never an issue with us, but if you park on the main street, be sure to read the signs as they wash the streets and you can't park on a certain side on a certain day. We were very pleased with the price of this place. After doing lots of research on the web, I think Balboa Park Inn is truly exceptional for the value. Next time we're in SD, I'll probably book this place again, but with a different room (not because I didn't like Aruba, but because the other rooms look beautiful as well). Someone mentioned that this isn't really a bed & breakfast, but more like a 'hotel'. I would have to agree that it's not the conventional 'bed & breakfast', because you don't get to meet the owners and it doesn't really feel like a 'house'. If you're just looking for a clean, convenient, comfortable place to stay, then consider this Inn. If you're looking for the full-fledged Bed and Breakfast feel, then this may not be to your liking.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jfd07
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth stay, each time in a different room. The area is quiet and safe, and just a short walk away you can find the restaurants of the Hillcrest area. The rooms are a terrific value. This was my third suite- I really like having a kitchen and sofa especially for a stay of more than a couple of days. It felt more like an apartment than a hotel. I will say the breakfast has gotten a bit skimpy since my first visit when there was fruit as well as cereal or pastries. However, I knew that lunch and dinner would be substantial each day, so a simple breakfast was fine. I enjoyed a late night hot chocolate on my balcony each night- a great way to wind down. Someone mentioned the air conditioner- yes, it was very loud and a step stool was provided to turn adjust it (not a great idea for a person with creaky knees). But the nights were so cool I didn't use it, even though it was August. The only other thing I'd add is room darkening shades. The room was brightly lit from the lights outside and morning seemed to come awfully early.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: amberLeiv
Reviews.Content: This really was a lovely place to stay. The neighborhood was friendly and felt very safe, plus it was just a step away from Balboa Park. The parking was usually very easy to find, it was only when we would come back somewhat late (around 12 or 1 am) that we would have difficulty finding parking and have to park somewhat far away. The room was adorable and we loved the convenience of having a kitchen and a door that led to the sun terrace. The air conditioner in the room is a little loud and though it could probably drive some people insane it actually helped me sleep better haha.The service was always kind and helpful. My only real complaint is that the walls are a little thin. I felt a bit strange being able to hear every word of the peoples conversation in the room next to us, it made me want to talk very softly because i was worried about disturbing them or just the fact that they could hear every word i was saying as well was creepy. The buildings seem to be a little old so it wasn't really a surprise that the walls were so thin. But overall it was a great experience and I wouldn't mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gflaz54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Lovely welcome and easy to find. No problems parking on roadside. Rooms are all themed. Ours had a full kitchen which was great as we made our own meal one night and got pizza delivered on another. Very comfortable, spacious rooms. It was very peaceful in the courtyard where our room was situated and the roof terrace was pretty where we ate breakfast. The staff were very friendly and gave us all the information we needed. We found the location very convenient. It was a ten minute walk to the zoo where we spent a whole day and about a fifteen minute walk to the park where you could pick up the trolley bus tour. Definitely a place to remember

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - great location”
Reviews.Author: plstrom
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego for the first time and wanted to stay away from the big chain hotels, which are expensive. We also wanted to get a feel of some of the city neighborhoods. Balboa Park Inn was perfect for our needs. We could walk to the San Diego Zoo and all of the attractions in Balboa Park. We also could walk up to some great restaurants on University Ave. The room we stayed in had a kitchen, so we saved some money and bought some simple things at the local Trader Joes (which was welcome after spending all day on our feet at the zoo). Don't worry too much about parking - we were there from Wednesday through the following Tuesday and never had a problem getting a spot on the street, right in front of the place. We took the car out several times to go to places like Torrey Pines, Cabrillo, La Jolla and Coronado (lest you think we parked and left it there for the week). There can be a bit of noise from the street - you are in the middle of a residential neighborhood - so get a room on the inner courtyard if that's a concern. It's also a safe place to walk around in the evenings, which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Shoggoth
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for the Holiday Inn or the typical large chain hotel experience, do not stay at Balboa Park Inn. However, if you appreciate (or at least aren't bothered by) quirky touches like plastic flowers, this off-the-beaten-path B&B has a lot going for it. We stayed here with our preteen son in one of the suites, which was perfect for us. The kitchen was nice to have -- we got dinner from the local Whole Foods in Hillcrest a couple of nights we were there, and the kitchen has all the basics you need (including a corkscrew!). The service was great, the beds were comfy, the rooms were clean, there wasn't much noise from the street, and you can't beat the location. Oh, and there's free wireless broadband. After reading other reviews, we skipped the breakfast and either ate in or visited the fabulous Bread & Cie in Hillscrest. Some people here have complained about parking, but we had no problems finding a parking space on the street. Most nights we got a spot right in front of our building's door; two other times we had to park a short walk around the corner, but this didn't bother us. We would happily stay at Balboa Park Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “"America's Finest" - Finest Secret - The Balboa Park Inn”
Reviews.Author: 13beaches
Reviews.Content: Tucked away in the heart of America's Finest City (that's what San Diego calls itself- and for good reason) is a B & B so quaint, so comfortable, so well run and so unusual, you'll be amazed you haven't heard of it before. It's not at the beach (not even on a hill overlooking one) and no, it's not in famous La Jolla or downtown in the trendy Gaslamp Quarter. In fact, the BALBOA PARK INN is right where it says it is, at the edge of one of the truly great city parks in America, a 5 minute walk from the San Diego Zoo and more than a dozen top-notch museums-all located in, yes - Balboa Park. BALBOA PARK INN is a restored guest house from the early part of the last century, now comprising 26 unique, differently appointed and themed suites - all affording the best in value, comfort, convenience and originality - and the food ain't half-bad either. It's romantic for the couple who is looking for something really fun or perfect for the stressed-out business traveler in town for a few days and looking to get "un-stressed". It's a 2-minute drive to downtown, 12 minutes to the airport, and just a few minutes from either the "Gaslamp" or the "Hillcrest" neighborhoods, both packed with one-of-a-kind restaurants, exciting night-life and unique shopping. Prices run from around $100- $250, all are suites, some with mirrored beds, fireplaces and jacuzzi tubs and the top-of-the line rooms, such as the "Jungle Nook" or "Greystoke" are so wonderfully playful you may find it difficult to venture out (ala Jane and Robert in "Barefoot in the Park"). I live in San Diego but make it a point to "escape" every now and then to the BALBOA PARK INN - it's a one night vacation and lucky you if you're checking in for a longer visit.

Reviews.Title: “This place is perfect and the staff are amazing. There is parking.”
Reviews.Author: Hollywood_Sun
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Balboa Park Inn at least 5 times driving down to San Diego from LA and this place is exceptional! Yes, there is street parking and I have never had trouble finding a parking spot-ever. The rooms are cute and some have mini kitchens in them which I love because I always go to the store and cook a foil tray of cinnamon rolls so my room smells yummy. The front desk staff are always available for me and have sometimes let me check in early if my room is ready, I just call ahead to check. This place is clean and not only located near the zoo but also shopping in Hillcrest. I recommend Balboa Park inn and really, I won't stay anywhere else. LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE- NOWHERE TO PARK!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ericcomic
Reviews.Content: The room is fine, if a little tacky- but there is absolutely no parking anywhere!!! The liar who took my reservation assured me there was plenty of street parking and that, in a pinch I could park across the street at the school. Neither statement was true. We drove around in circles for an hour every time we needed to park- and the staff was totally unsympathetic. On top of that, they did not warn us that we'd have to move our car for alternate side parking on Mon morning. Pretty much ruined our trip. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - perfect suite”
Reviews.Author: heavenlyjane
Reviews.Content: We wanted a place that was an easy stroll to the zoo. Balboa Park Inn fit the bill being 5-minutes away. I was extremely pleased with our accommodations, a suite named Suite Cycles. AMMENITIES: For our money (the same amount we'd pay a hotel), we got a bedroom, living room and kitchen. We bought read-to-eat meals at a near-by Whole Foods and made good use of the kitchen. SPECIAL TOUCHES: Our visit coincided with a rain winter rainstorm and the innkeepers lent us a big umbrella so we could puddle-jump our way through the zoo - that was a generous offer that we really appreciated. BREAKFAST: unexciting - a choice of stale pasteries or cold cereal with milk; We skipped it after the first morning. PARKING: Free street parking was easy to find. We always found a spot in front of the hotel. BOTTOM-LINE: We would recommend this place heartily.

Reviews.Title: “An inn with a charming personality”
Reviews.Author: marshwatcherMaine
Reviews.Content: The beds are extremely comfortable. The rooms are clean and obviously planned and decorated with thoughtful care and imaginative taste. I agree with other reviewers' use of the words "quirky" and "quaint." The location next to Balboa Park's museums, zoo, and restaurants is very convenient. It's a great place to come and relax - why bother to stay anywhere else in San Diego!! The price is very good value for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for some, not all, travelers.”
Reviews.Author: Susan_in_NC
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot of character, but it’s not the sort you’d find in, say, an urban boutique hotel. There’s nothing “put on” about this place; it's not trendy and it doesn't have attitude. I found the furniture and decor (including ample bouquets of artificial flowers) pretty tacky/kitschy, but beauty is in the eye of the beholder, and in any case this did not put me off the hotel, which was very clean, comfortable and homey. Fair warning, though – if you’re a traveler who enjoys the sleek monotony of a corporate chain hotel, if you’re a design guru, or if you consider tastefulness to be next to Godliness, this probably isn’t the hotel for you. Our suite, “Medley,” contained a cozy living room with a television, a smallish bedroom with a queen bed, a modest no-frills bathroom, a spacious fully-equipped eat-in kitchen overlooking the terrace, and two closets. We were able to enjoy San Diego’s famous climate by keeping the windows open at all times and we slept soundly in quiet comfort. It appears that each suite has a different configuration, so those wanting a large, luxurious bathroom should choose a different suite, but the layout and amenities were fine for the two of us. A hair dryer, iron, ironing board and all such necessities were provided. I was particularly impressed with how well-stocked the kitchen was, with a full range of Kitchenaid pots, pans and utensils, in addition to the dishes, coffee maker, fridge, range, microwave, etc. It felt like we were staying not in a hotel but in someone’s small and old but well-maintained apartment. This feeling is amplified by the fact that the hotel is in a quiet residential neighborhood and not the bustling downtown. The location means you can’t just step out of your hotel room and have your choice of restaurants and shops within blocks, but if you enjoy walking it’s a reasonable and pleasant walk to the Hillcrest area which is full of options for eating and shopping. I enjoyed walking past the charming little bungalows and cottages of all different styles that make up the neighborhood. You couldn’t be closer to the zoo, and it’s an easy walk further into Balboa Park. During our relatively short visit we didn’t make use of public transit, but when you call a cab (which the staff will happily do for you whenever you ask), it arrives quickly. The distances to anywhere you’re likely to want to go are generally pretty small, so getting around should not be a problem. The free Wi-Fi is certainly appreciated. As for breakfast, it’s a tall glass of juice with either a bowl of cereal or a basket of various edible but frankly unappetizing pastries. I don’t choose hotels based on the quality of the breakfasts provided so this was not much of a negative for me. Bottom line: this hotel would not be right for everyone – some people would love it (“quirky, unique, homey”) for the very same reasons that others would hate it (“tacky, kitschy, dated”). However you can easily get a sense of what the hotel is like by checking out the photos on the hotel’s website, so there shouldn’t be any surprises. If you like what you see online, you will undoubtedly enjoy your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What a quaint, eclectic place!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: partdudelv
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Friaday, Oct. 23rd at 2:45 pm. Alan at the front desk provided us with all the info we needed. (directions, maps, how far to the nearest store). What a helpful employee. We had reserved the Country Talk mini suite. WOW!!! 4 rooms, a fully equipped kitchen, king size bed in a roomy bedroom, living room with a couch , loveseat & a chair. tv with a boatload of channels. A good size bathroom. A balcony thet leads to a patio are that was great for breakfast. It'a about a 8-10 minute walk to the zoo, which was great!!! Get there about 8:30 am so you don't wait in line very long since it opens at 9. About 5-10 minutes past the zoo is Balboa Park. Another great area. Do the auto musuem & the sports Museum. Highly recommended. Alan also suggested dinner at Busalacchi's Italian restaurant. One of the best meals we've ever had!!! The only drawback was that almost anywhere you want to go, you really need a cab. There are no mini-marts or 7-11's in the area. There is a liquor store about 7 blocks from the inn. They have everything you need. We will definitely come back for another visit, but we will be driving. We hope Alan will still be be.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Comfortable bed, Clean”
Reviews.Author: swsteph
Reviews.Content: It was more than I expected. We walked to Balboa Park every day and walked to University Ave for dinner each evening. Because of the close proximity to the zoo we were able to take our time wondering the zoo over 2 days and never felt rushed. It was simple to take public transportation to the beach. The staff were extremely friendly & helpful but not overly zealous. The bed was extremely comfortable, the kitchen was clean, the eating nook was cozy and the living room was spacious enough for a family of 3 to hang out. For our budget and our plans this was by far the best choice for our family. I hope to stay there the next time we go to San Diego. Note: We stayed in the California Suite

Reviews.Title: “A Very Cute and Funky Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: BluEmu
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a brief 2 night vacation in San Diego. We chose the Balboa Park Inn because it was right next to the park and the price was excellent. We stayed in the City Lights Room. The room was very clean and well equipped. The weather was delightful so we just opened the windows and did not need air conditioning. The only negative to this room is that it is on Park Avenue. If you sleep like my husband it is not problem at all, but if you are a lighter sleeper like I am you will hear some street traffic noiise. That said I would definitely stay here again. You might also inquire whether the room is on the second floor. It could be a climb for someone who has bad knees. Judy (I don't know if she is a worker bee or owns the hotel or both) is a very nice lady and will help you with anything you need. You can take your breakfast in your room, on the patio or on the sun terrace. We took our on the patio and we very happy with the muffins, rolls, cereal, juice and coffee to start our day. If you are a walker, it is a very easy walk to the zoo and to the museums. Also, there are many nice restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: canadian-in-LA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to spend the weekend in San Diego and visit the zoo, so the Balboa Park Inn was in the perfect location, within 5 minutes' walking distance of the zoo and the rest of Balboa Park. I wasn't quite sure what to expect because some reviewers had said that the Inn was old and funky, but I was delighted by our stay. I'd reserved the Monet's junior suite, but upon our arrival, we were informed that the manager had given us a free upgrade to an even nicer suite, the Nouveau Ritz. We were very happy with our suite, which was extremely clean and very quiet. I found the room decor pleasant without being kitschy - it definitely had more character than a generic hotel room. The staff was helpful without being intrusive. Breakfast was very simple - juice, pastries, and cereal - but it was good. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: jfd07
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth visit to the Balboa Park Inn, staying in a different room each time. This trip I chose a mini suite (Monet's), with living room (two recliners and sofa), kitchen with full size refrigerator, microwave, coffee pot and toaster and small and very comfortable queen-bedded room. Everything was immaculately clean (the shade in the bedroom didn't always rise, no big deal). Yes the decor is a bit kitschy, with ample silk flower arrangements, but that's part of the charm. A plus is the ceiling fan in every room, for a bit of cooling when the air conditioner is too much. This year it seemed the breakfast was a bit smaller than last time (no fresh fruit) but at the end of the week I noticed I could have ordered both cereal and pastry instead of just one or the other. That plus juice was more than I needed and even provided a treat for a snack later in the day. The biggest delight was the price- even including cab fare to downtown it was still cheaper than the downtown boxy hotels. (The bus is even cheaper.) Plus, free breakfast and plenty of coffee, tea and cocoa mean trips to the local coffee shop are unnecessary. The location is perfect- between Balboa Park and Hillcrest, an interesting neighborhood with great ethnic restaurants at much lower price than downtown. I can't wait for next year's visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and would go back again - but for a whole week, instead of 2 nights!”
Reviews.Author: mrscoviello
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled the coast along Rte 1 for a week. We stayed in 5 hotels along the way and this was definitely our favorite. We stayed in the Aruba Room ($99 a night). The room is small but the bathroom is gigantic. There is a whilpool tub, which felt great after a long day of walking around. The room has a small fridge, micro, and coffee maker. They even give you a couple of plates and silverware, tons of teas, hot chocolate, coffee, and paper towels. Free, on street parking. We did not have a problem parking right in front of the gate either night. The Aruba room is in the back so it was very quiet. Loved the breakfast. one morning, we had it delivered in less than 10 minutes, the other day we were a little disappointed it took a little over a half hour. You get one of 3 kinds of juice (a pretty good size glass) and can choose cereal and/or pastries (warm) in a basket. We ate on the patio both mornings while planning our day. Would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely magical experience”
Reviews.Author: KiwiMel88
Reviews.Content: I booked this wonderful little hotel last minute (two weeks before I was due to arrive) as I was coming to San Diego for Comic Con. Initially they only had one night available as they were fully booked out for the rest of the week. I requested they keep me updated in case there are any cancellations. As fortune would have it, there were & I was able to stay for 6 nights in the "Suite Escape". The hotel staff was very quick & friendly about getting in touch with me whenever cancellations occured so I could prolong my stay. Absolutely marvellous communication & within 4 days of my initial booking, I had all 6 nights confirmed. The room was very clean, spacious, beautifully & uniquely decorated, & instantly made me feel at home. The service was outstanding, everyone was beyond friendly & welcoming. Being a mid-twenties single female tourist, safety is a big concern for me. In my two weeks in California, this was the only place I truly felt well looked after. I felt like part of the Balboa Park Inn family! Even if this hotel charged twice as much, I would still consider it a bargain. Not to mention, this was the only hotel I found online that did not quadruple its prices during Comic Con, like all the big hotels do. From now on, this is the only place I would stay at when visiting San Diego. A truly wonderful B & B that I highly & gladly recommend to all!

Reviews.Title: “Unique and charming and very close to the San Deigo Zoo!”
Reviews.Author: lgmiller
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in the "Beach House" Room. It was very nice in a different and whimsical way. Beach motif murals throughout and really roomy. The bathroom is enormous with a very nice jacuzzi tub. It was clean and comfy. The bed was really lovely...felt like sleeping on a cloud. It is a short walk over to the zoo which was the reason for our visit and not to be missed. I think it must be one of the finest zoos in the world. Will definitely go back to stay again and see more of Balboa Park! The people were very helpful and made it one of our more memorable anniversaries! Thanks Balboa Park Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Fun place for a budget traveler or traveling with kids to Balboa Park”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaEremita
Reviews.Content: Since we were only staying in San Diego one night and didn't need a lot of space we opted for the $99 Aruba room. The room is small, but it's in the very back of the hotel and extremely private. We had no disturbances or noise what-so-ever while we were in the room, it was great! The bathroom is huge and has a whirl-pool bath tub which we didn't use, but is a nice feature even if it is a little old and out dated looking. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable enough. The decor is a little kitchy, we had colorful plastic fish strung from the ceiling, but if you are expecting this element it can be fun. The staff was very friendly when we arrived, showing us where we could park on the street and taking us to our room. There is a small continental breakfast that can be requested and brought to your room. It's not a gourmet breakfast, but it's still a nice touch and you can eat it outside on one of the many patio tables they provide. There is also a coffee maker and provided coffee in your room if you want to have that with breakfast. The hotel is located on the edge of Balboa park and easily walking distance to the zoo. It's a great choice if your primary San Diego destination is Balboa Park! Overall, the hotel is a great place if you don't need super fancy accommodations and just want a nice, clean, safe place to stay for a very reasonable price while you are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Clean, Affordable”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirls11
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on TripAdvisor and got pretty much what I expected. I stayed in the City Lights room for two nights. Everything was clean. Liked the fridge, microwave, free Wi-Fi. Location was convenient next to Zoo & Park. Very cute little neighborhood, but still close drive to beaches. Everyone was friendly. Felt safe for a girl traveling alone. Only drawback, the only parking was on the streets, which sometimes was a little full or very tight squeezes. Also the electrical outlet in bathroom was up by the light, which isn't very convenient. Overall, great deal if you don't need anything super fancy and are looking for something clean, safe and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: bluedogtravels
Reviews.Content: The Balboa Park Inn is heavenly! Quiet, clean, friendly and fabulous are only a few of the words that can describe this unique lodging. Close to the happening and hip University Avenue, across the street from the Zoo, I can't say enough about how much I loved staying in this hotel. Our room had a living room, a bedroom and kitchenette. The space and layout were fabulous as we were there a few days and never felt crowded. I highly recommend the Balboa Park Inn, the owner is on-site and the staff -Jim - are terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Authentic hotel close to Balbao Park”
Reviews.Author: Josbob
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of the location (really at the border of Balbao Park) and the variety of rooms. The rooms are located in several old buildings and are all different. We had Suite Sanctuary with full kitchen which was very nice. The price is relatively low, the service is good. The bedroom was not at the streetside and quiet. It had a king, but two beds is also an option. Housekeeping was excellent. We loved the Bilbao Park with all the musea and the wonderful zoo. Also other parts of San Diego are worthwhile, such as the beautiful beaches (especially Corona Beach) and old downtown. Any negative points? Not much. Maybe the sun terrace which has no view and is not very cozy. And you better skip the free breakfast which is only sweet cakes and cereal. Overall a wonderful hotel which we highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Old, kitschy motel; good location; great staff”
Reviews.Author: LA2Ventura
Reviews.Content: The Inn's location is convenient and the excellent staff are friendly and helpful. We spent three nights in the Beach House room, which was relatively secluded and devoid of outside noise. Getting to the Beach House required a walk through a narrow "canyon" between two buildings whose sides are heavily covered with undisguised pipes (for water, gas, etc.). The path continued through a narrow, cluttered courtyard. We noticed that some of the planters still had price stickers still on them. The Beach House room door had frosted glass inserts that were worn in places, potentially enabling outsiders to look all around the room. We tore off pieces of paper and stuck them in the window frames for greater privacy. The room itself was decorated in a mostly tropical theme and there was a mural on one wall. The room also contained a small LCD TV (we could not get any of the HD channels), three fake trees (the one by the bed looked like it was made from an old Christmas tree), an air purifier, and a mini-fridge. Both appliances made a noticeable hum that eventually became distracting. The window fan/heater/AC unit was very noisy and the controls were hard to reach. There are mini-blinds and curtains on the windows. The blinds and sheers close but the opaque curtains do not. That could be a problem for folks who require greater darkness for sleep. There is abundant light for reading, but the two wicker chaise lounges have slippery cushions on them. As for cleanliness, the room was immaculate except for a silverfish crawling across the bedspread (ugh!), some well-worn brochures on the bureau, and a sponge left on the bathroom floor. Speaking of the bathroom, it is spacious, contains lots of mirrors and plush towels, and features a jacuzzi with a mirrored, faux-candle-lit surround. Directions for the jacuzzi are too brief and confusing to be helpful. (A desk clerk was unable to decipher them.) The shower stall is roomy but hot water can be slow in coming. The amenities include body lotion that smells very strongly of peppermint. There are dozens of gaudy, artsys-craftsy fish hanging from the ceiling. We thought they might look cute in a child's room. Skip the unimpressive continental breakfast (the Inn's only room service) and head over to Richard Walker's Pancake House, which is open for lunch as well. The food, service, and ambiance are all top-notch and worth a wait.

Reviews.Title: “Location was wonderful walking distance to Balboa Park”
Reviews.Author: SunnyOkan
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 week in San Diego. We booked the Balboa Park Inn because of it was close to Balboa Park. It was wonderful to walk to the Park and enjoy the zoo, museums and other attractions. We purchased some food and beverages and enjoyed a snack on the sunny terrace in the afternoon. The room was spacious and clean. It was great to have a separate sitting room, bedroom and kitchen. From Balboa Park we took the Trolley tour, excellent value, and a cab from downtown was about $10.00. Our room was very quiet in the evening and a short walk to Hillcrest and many dining choices. I would recommend the Balboa Park Inn as an refreshing alternative to a standard hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel IN THE WORLD......”
Reviews.Author: margaHalfMoonBay_CA
Reviews.Content: This is a truly hidden jewel. It is one of the most unique and welcoming Inns that I have ever stayed. I have been coming to the Balboa Park Inn for over 20 years and it just becomes lovelier with each visit. This is because the general manager and owner, Mr. Ed Wilcox is passionate and meticulous about the Inn He is constantly changing the decor of these beautiful rooms with a unique artistc fervor that I have never seen. The suites are all very unique with exquisite pieces of art that sometimes come from his personal collection. I asked Ed does he have a special security system to protect his magnificent pieces and he assures me that people that stay at the hotel are gracious and respectful.. although I know he would know in 2 seconds if anything went missing! All the rooms are wonderful and different to fit peoples needs and taste. I love to stay in each room to experience the uniqueness. The "creme d' la creme" is the Greystoke Suite which is out of this world! The collection of bedroom furniture is a collectable ensemble and the spa bathroom is amazing! The tile work in the bathroom is a work of art on its own. You must see it to believe it! It even has a fireplace in the SPA! There is also a fireplace in the living room as well. The hotel location is perfect for business or pleasure as it is centrally located with easy access to a major highway, however it is situated on a quiet little street next to the beautiful Balboa Park. Of course there is wireless access and a yummy continental breakfast that they bring to your room! The best part are the prices they are reasonable in fact I think a bargain.... For all these reasons I have been a loyal customer and will continue to be one! This is 5 STAR hotel with a 3 STAR pricing- don't miss it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind -- wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: Namekal
Reviews.Content: Before I booked my room at the Balboa Park Inn, I was told that the owner/manager loves to lavish attention on his rooms, and this is definitely the case. Each room in this remarkable B&B is uniquely stamped with its own personality -- Paris in the 30s, the American Southwest, the islands, the African veldt -- each with its own special decor, appointments, and amenities. Many of the rooms have ensuite jacuzzis and fully equipped kitchens. The room I spent two nights in had a Stickley sleigh bed and the world's most amazing walk-in shower! The proprietor, Ed Wilcox, is very knowledgeable about his rooms and the Inn's history (it was built for the 1915 Panama-California Exposition). I have only good things to say about the staff. The housekeepers go the extra mile on details (I returned each night to find my hand towels neatly folded into fantails). The front desk managers were always prompt and attentive, particularly on the afternoon/evening shift. All of the restaurant recommendations I received were outstanding. And the Inn is right there at the park's entrance, so you don't have to go far for a great day out. Book it now!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: AlbuquerqueSparkle
Reviews.Content: We were there for our 25TH and it was wonderful!!! Staff were friendly and very helpful. We stayed in #11 the suite cycles room. I posted pictures. The location was key and we loved the feel of having our own apt. A short walk to THE zoo and Balboa Park. The terraces at night under the moonlight with the quiet sounds of the neighborhood. We would stay here again in a heart beat. If you are set in staying by the ocean then look somewhere else, but for the zoo and Balboa park and the area itself....it was a great experince for us. I highly recommend the suite cycles room. From this location we had no trouble finding our way to the ocean. Also if you are planning on doing the tolley tour,there is a pick up spot at the zoo and balboa park. And then you can be dropped off there too,with a short walk back home.

Reviews.Title: “This Inn Makes Me Happy”
Reviews.Author: FastFlo
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I am a traveler, not a tourist. I have stayed at the Serena Inn in Zanzibar, both the Mount Grace and the Cape Grace in South Africa and the Hotel des Artistes in Paris. I travel a lot and I love to stay at small but comfortable places. The large hotels and the execubox, not for me if it can be avoided. This Inn has become my favorite of all time. There are about 20 different rooms. Really different., each has a different theme that is done to perfection. I, my family and friends have stayed in about half of them. They are beautifully decorated, many with large jacuzzi tubs. Even some small rooms have the tubs. Some of the rooms also have full kitchens if you are with your family. There are natural food markets and supermarkets just minutes away. There is a very nice enclosed central patio with lovely seating and many of the rooms have their own porches with bistro tables and chairs. There is a large lovely sun roof where you can bask in the sun or watch the stars. It is quiet, clean and friendly. They are walking distance from the San Diego Zoo, several museums, a spectacular rose garden and if you like them, an even more spectacular cactus garden that covers probably close to half a mile and a whole hillside. The Globe Theatre is also in Balboa Park. They are less than a $10 taxi ride from downtown San Diego, Amtrak, the airport and the port of San Diego where you can see some really great historic sailing ships. The staff is very friendly and helpful. There is a lovely little gift area in the lobby. It has saved me time occasionally just by having items I would actually give as gifts which don't cost an arm and a leg. The staff does everything they can to accommodate your wishes and have brochures with maps to everything in SD. They are also very good at either bringing you what you need within minutes or staying completely out of your life. I love these people and I always feel completely safe when I am there. No matter what I am doing in SD, I would never dream of staying anywhere else if I need to be in town overnight. Between 2004, when I was directed to them by someone who really LOVES me, and today, I have never stayed anywhere else when in SD. I am ashamed of myself for not having written this sooner. But as I said, I am a traveler so time is not always on my side. However, after my last trip there when I was with them for 6 days instead of the usual 2 or 3, I saw that the congeniality is constant and only gets better with time. So I took the time to tell them I love them and to tell you, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great neighborhood, like staying at grandmas”
Reviews.Author: MarianaG
Reviews.Content: This is a small older hotel with kitchens or microwave/refridgerator and continental breakfast. We stayed in the Beach House and it is Miami beach designed. The pluses; big king size bed, big room, large bathroom with double size shower and jacuzzi tub. The place is dated and it shows. It was clean. The breakfast is just lots of carbohydrates and some fruit juice; some fruit or yogurt would have been nice. You make your own coffee in the room. The pillows were large and foamy. Location, Location. This place is in a safe neighborhood with free parking. It is next to Balboa park and the Hillcrest neighborhood where you can find every type of restaurant, Whole Foods, Ralphs, pharmacies, etc. Parking is free but you have to find it on the street. The room was quiet!!! The room had an old window heater/AC unit that ran/off all the time. The linens are dated. This is like staying at grandmas without grandma walking in.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CatLuvr
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Balboa Park Inn. Don't expect luxury at this property. Do expect a very clean room and exceptionally friendly staff. They held our bags for the day while we toured the city, called us a cab, got our breakfast order 100% correct and were very friendly. We stayed in the "Suite Escape" room. Plenty of space for two people who like each other. Small bathroom but very clean. The room faces a main road so maybe avoid if you have problems with traffic noise. As many other reviewers have mentioned, the decorating schemes are eclectic and in my opinion, lots of fun. Overall, highly recommended for a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Balboa Park Inn”
Reviews.Author: Wynda
Reviews.Content: We recently spent one night at the Inn so we could enjoy Balboa park without the long drive home. The Inn is as close as you can be to the park without being on the grounds. Everything was so convenient that we were able to walk to everything without being tired and we never had to use the car. The Inn itself is charming and cozy, with lots of extra touches. Everyone we encountered at the check-in desk was friendly and helpful. Our room was decorated for the holidays which was a nice touch and really made us feel at home. I was a little nervous about the comfort of the beds because of previous reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised with the comfort and there was NO crinkly sound at all. Our bedroom had two tempur-pedic pillows along with four other soft pillows and a humidifier. We booked a few days before our stay so the only room left had only one bed, but the Inn had an inflatable bed ready when we arrived for our 10 year old. Our room had two tv's, a kitchen with utensils,microwave,full size fridge, coffee pot and small table. There was also a living room area with a working faux fireplace along with a small ironing board and iron. The bathrooms were very clean and stocked with toiletries and tons of towels. We've stayed at all sorts of hotels from Hilton to Hojo's but this was the most pleasant experience I've had so far. Anytime we stay in San Diego I will book the Balboa Park Inn from now on. Did I mention that they bring a complimentary breakfast to your room? How awesome is that! (Our room was the Talmadge)

Reviews.Title: “Funky, Fun and Unique”
Reviews.Author: StuandEm
Reviews.Content: Of the 8 hotels that we stayed in on this trip, the Balboa Park Inn was our favourite. We stayed for four nights in the Beach House suite which proved to be a great choice. On arrival we were greeted with a warm, friendly welcome and shown to our room personally. The bedroom itself was completely unique with murals on the walls, a large bed, loungers, fridge, microwave and coffee maker. If the bedroom was great, the bathroom was amazing with a large shower, jacuzzi tub, more towels than you could ever need and colourful fish hanging from the ceiling. The whole place was quirky and fun. Breakfast is served in the room each morning, although you could also have it in the courtyard or on the sun deck – just call reception 15 minutes before you’re ready for it with your choice. The location of the Balboa Park Inn was also excellent, in a residential neighbourhood on the northern edge of the park very close to the zoo. Parking is available on the street next to the hotel, although it could get quite busy. A couple of nights we had to park around the block but this was not a problem as it was only a couple of minutes walk away on quiet streets. We loved the Balboa Park Inn – it is quirky and fun with a great attention to detail. Both the accommodation and service were top class, and we would go back without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Travel with Family & Friends”
Reviews.Author: barrhp
Reviews.Content: The Balboa Park Inn was a terrific find for us. Because we have an infant, we needed to have separate spaces for sleeping & gathering -- the Mayfair Suite MORE than met this need with its large living room and two bedrooms. The full kitchen was also a terrific asset as we didn't want to pack up and leave the hotel for every meal. We even prepared a meal and then ate out in the courtyard one evening -- it was quite peaceful. The location was ideal for meeting friends with small kids -- just a short walk to the zoo. When we were up for a longer stroll, the rest of Balboa Park had tons to offer -- museums, shops, picnic areas, and the ever-essential: playground. The hotel is also only a short drive from a number of restaurants and grocery stores -- not too far from I-5 (main interstate thorough-fare) -- and only 12 minutes from the airport. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful, even altering the cleaning schedule to work around the baby's nap time. Overall, we had a great experience with the Balboa Park Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Service out of this world!”
Reviews.Author: tjboly
Reviews.Content: My father was scheduled to come spend a week with me in august/2008. I booked the reservation at the Balboa Park Inn about a month in advance. My Dad's flight was cancelled and I had to reschedule my reservation. Both Edward, the owner, and Judy, the Manager, did everything to give us a new reservation and were nice enough to understand that this situation was out of our control, so they did not charge us for the change. How wonderful to deal with a hotel that undesrtands it's all about service! I highly recommend this fun,well located hotel in San Diego! Karen

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: vdams
Reviews.Content: My husband two teenage kids and I stayed four nights at this bed and breakfast as part of our two week vacation to california. This was our last stop and it was perfect. First off the neighborhood that its located in is great. Hilcrest area of san diego has great shopping, restaurants and of course within walking distance to balboa park and the zoo. The Inn is old but very well kept. We stayed in room 14 emmas diary and it was lovely. two bedrooms and a pull out sofa in the kitchen/living area. The patio is lovely and we had breakfast out there every morning. The room was cleaned everyday while we were out and no one disturbed us while we slept in. had great nights sleep on the confortable beds. no street noise very quiet and cozy. We felt like part of the community staying here. I would suggest it for anyone who wants to stay in a comfortable place in a nice area for great rates. Its not near all of the other hotels and you truly feel like a resident and not a tourist.Breakfast was included it was the usual continental fare. Never a problem with parking on street in front of the inn. I and my family loved this place and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable palce to stay--for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: 0wlbear
Reviews.Content: Clean, charming, and centrally located, my only regret about the Balboa Park Inn is that we didn't stay here the whole time. It has character-- those without imagination may find it tacky--but it was the perfect place for my girlfriend and I to feel like we were crashing at home in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Priestbot
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Balboa Park Inn at the end of our honeymoon after travelling through California. After the bright lights of LA, the Balboa Park Inn was a breath of freah air - I have never stayed anywhere quiet like it and was very impressed. We stayed in the 'Beach House' which was wonderfully spacious and comfortable, we were able to spread out properly. Everything was immaculately clean and the bed was incredibly comfy. The bathroom was fantastic with a huge Jacuzzi bath, perfect for soaking weary feet after a day at the zoo! The hotel was so laid back and quiet, you felt as if you had it all to yourselves and we enjoyed having early evening drinks in the courtyard. San Diego itself was also great, very chilled, some great restaurants including the Strip Club where you grill your own meat, good value, delicious food. Our stay rounded off a superb holiday and if we ever return to San Diego, we will definitely be back at the Balboa!

Reviews.Title: “A great accommodation choice. Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: infolondon
Reviews.Content: I booked Balboa Park based on previous TripAdvisor reviews. They weren't wrong. This is an excellent place. The room was a good size, bed was comfortable and all the staff were friendly and helpful. In fact the cleaner even found a necklace which we had left in our room on check out. The hotel provides some nice touches like daily newspaper delivered to your room. I have struggled to find anything negative to mention. However I've come up with some advice should you consider staying here. - Breakfast - Breakfast is a choice of either cereals or croissants and buns. Both options come with fresh fruit. The croissants and buns are particular good, highly recommended. It is nice that they will deliver the breakfast to your room or outside terrace. However after about 3 or 4 days the options do become a bit repetitive. - Water pressure - The water pressure in the shower wasn't as powerful as ideally I would have liked. Although I'm sure this is outside of the hotel's control. - Location - The hotel location is good, but possibly not for everyone. If you don't drive (I don't) please consider the following. I considered the hotel to be in good safe neighbourhood and I felt safe when walking around the area at all times of day or night. It appears to be quite a residential area. The hotel is a 90 second walk to a bus stop for route 7 which runs into downtown. The bus service runs quite frequently about every 12 minutes in the day, and about every 20 minutes in the evening. It takes about 10 minutes to City College where you can transfer on to the San Diego trolley. The hotel is about 10 minute walk south to San Diego Zoo, Rose Garden and a few more minutes to attractions like the model railway museum. 10 minutes walk north of the hotel on to university avenue is Starbucks, 7 11, other restaurants and bars. From university avenue you can catch bus 10 to old town. - Flowers - The flowers in the room are artificial. Not a problem, but might be worth noting. - Pizza delivery - Like a lot of places Balboa Park Inn provides some local information leaflets in the room.
